resources.string: Press to start comparing step counting
It allows the simultaneous use of the three implemented step counting algorithms.
Pedometer that uses accelerometer data to evaluate the movement of a step. It uses a superimposed window data collection method of size 50, which is populated as data is read from the sensors.

Pedometer that uses GPS data with latitude and longitude to calculate the distance between two points and therefore the relative steps taken. The data detected by the sensors are updated every time a distance of at least 10 meters is covered.

Pedometer that uses accelerometer data to evaluate the movement of a step. The sensor data are not saved each time and used but the calculation of the steps takes place only with each new triplet of accelerometric data.
